All Classes

Class Description
ActionEvent
This Event is used by the client to send to the server a Position on a board, on which it wants to perform some operation: select a worker, move, build
ApolloCard
EGodPower.APOLLO
ArtemisCard
EGodPower.ARTEMIS
AthenaCard
EGodPower.ATHENA
AthenaCardDecorator
EGodPower.ATHENA
AtlasCard
EGodPower.ATLAS
Board
This class is a wrapper for a grid of Tiles (that is, a 2d array of Tiles) with some useful methods.
BoardEvent
This event is used by the server to notify the clients about some changes happened to a game board
BoardFactory
Factory class for Board, used for Dependency Injection when creating a new game
Card
This class represents the "base 2-player game".
CardDecorator
This class is the model of a Card decorator.
CardEvent
This Event is used to carry a specific god power/card, of type EGodPower
ChoiceEvent
This Event is used by the server, to ask the client a question with 2 possible answers, usually regarding the will to use a god power by che client, to answer the binary question
ChronusCard
EGodPower.CHRONUS
ChronusCardDecorator
EGodPower.CHRONUS
ClientApp  
ClientConnection
This class represents the client-side endpoint of a client-server socket connection
ClientView
This class displays the game's model objects so that the user can interact with them.
Connection
Connection is an abstract class that is used for the network connection between client and server.
Constants
The Constants class groups constants broadly used across the application
Controller
Controller represents the controller class made following the MVC pattern.
DemeterCard
EGodPower.DEMETER
DisconnectedEvent
This Event is used to indicate that some kind of client disconnection has happened, either voluntarily or accidentally
DisconnectedException
DisconnectedException is a type of Exception that is called after a network problem.
EGodPower
Represent a godcard or a godpower
ErrorEvent
This Event is used by the server to notify a client of a generic error
EStartupPhase
EStartupPhase is an enumeration of the different turn phases that follow one another before the actual start of the game
ETileLevel
Represents the possible building levels for a Tile.
ETurnPhase
Represent a phase of the game turn.
Event
Event is the generic interface for events (that is, sophisticated messages exchanged by client and server It implements the Serializable interface, so that an event can be sent through the network using an object stream
Game
Represents a single match.
GameFactory
Factory class for Game, used for Dependency Injection when creating a new game
GameOverEvent
This Event is used by the server to notify all the clients still connected to a game that a game over has been reached.
GameSceneController
This class represents the controller for the main scene of the GUI (the "game scene")
GUIClientApp  
GUIClientView
This class represents the GUI client-side view component of the application.
HephaestusCard
EGodPower.HEPHAESTUS
HeraCard
EGodPower.HERA
HeraCardDecorator
EGodPower.HERA
HestiaCard
EGodPower.HESTIA
HighlightEvent
This Event contains a list of Positions that have to be highlighted client-side, to inform a player about his possible next moves.
InitialUserSceneController
This class represents the controller for the initial user scene of the GUI
ListUtility
This class defines some utility methods for lists of generic elements
Logger
This class represent a simple String logger.
LoseEvent
This Event is used by the server to notify the clients of a game that someone lost
MessageEvent
MessageEvent represents an Event for a simple text message.
MinotaurCard
EGodPower.MINOTAUR
Observable
It is the Observable class of the Observer&Observable pattern.
Observer
Observer is the Observer interface of the Observer&Observable pattern.
PanCard
EGodPower.PAN
PingEvent
This Event represents a ping message, a simple and light heartbeat bounced back and forth by client and server and used by both to check that the other is still reachable through the network
Playable
This interface defines classes that can perform all game-related actions, allowing to play a turn completely.
Player
Player represents a player of the game.
PlayerNicknameEvent
This Event is sent by a client to the server and contains the nickname of one of the players in the game to which that client belongs
Position
This class represents an immutable position on a 2d 5x5 grid, with 0-indexed rows and columns.
PrometheusCard
EGodPower.PROMETHEUS
RemoteConnection
This class represents the server-side endpoint of a client-server socket connection
RemoteView
This class represents the user view element server-side.
RemoteViewDummy  
Server
This class represents the game server.
ServerApp  
SetChallengerEvent
This Event is used by the server to notify the clients of a game about the chosen challenger for a game
SetCurrentPlayerEvent
This Event is used by the server to notify the clients of a game about the current player, setting a new value for it
SetFirstPlayerEvent
This Event is used by the server to notify the clients of a game about the first player, set by the challenger during the initialization
SetNicknameEvent
This Event is used by the server as an ack, to notify a client that the nickname that was sent is valid and it is now assigned to it
SetNPlayersEvent
This Event is used by the server as an ack, to notify a client that is choice on the number of players was valid and accepted
StartGameEvent
StartGameEvent is an Event that is invoked when a new game has started, to notify all the connected players that the new game is ready to begin and tell them about the nicknames of their opponents
StartupPhaseEvent
StartupPhaseEvent is an Event that is invoked when we have to set a new EStartupPhase.
Tile
This class represents a cell of a Board.
TritonCard  
TurnPhaseEvent
TurnPhaseEvent is an Event that is invoked when a new ETurnPhase has to be set
View
The methods of the View class represents the operations common to both the ClientView-s and the RemoteView, which however take on different meanings depending on the side of the connection: server-side, the RemoteView reads objects (Events) from the socket and prints objects to the socket (forwarding Model's notifications to the ClientView) client-side, the ClientView reads from stdin and prints to stdout, with the most relevant inputs that are parsed and sent to the server through ClientConnection (so that view methods' invocation is forwarded to RemoteView) Details on the Observer/Observable pattern are given in the subclasses' descriptions
Worker
The Worker class represents a worker, a simple pawn on the Board.
ZeusCard
